ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Nothing, I did not learn anything that I already had picked up in L3. There was hardly any difference between the two courses except for the fact that I was somehow expected to be fluent in the language which was not an expectation in L3.

further German vocabulary, grammar and structures
Usage of the language in a practical setting by reading a novel.
I improved my German, and I practiced various grammatical concepts. I also learned about various German speaking cities and regions.
German grammar and vocabulary; improved speaking, writing, listening, and reading skills.
I gained much more knowledge of certain grammatical structures, as well as idiomatic expressions. Also, it was fun to learn more in depth about select cities in the Germanic speaking countries.
I got more experience with the German language
I developed my speaking, listening, reading and writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of this class came from the student side in that we all got along very well and helped each other. The course itself was not enjoyable. I felt attacked every single day and never was made to feel so unintelligent by a classroom environment ever. The range of work differed a lot- some night we had nothing and other nights we were completely overloaded. It made it all very difficult to manage and I was stressed out in class every single day.

Strengths -- Thorough exposure to a range of content. The textbook and online homework assignments were good and were reflective of the work we learned in formal instruction. Workload was consistent throughout the weeks and was a good amount of work spread fairly per day. Asynchronous work was good.

Weaknesses -- Most of in-class instruction was verbal, not so much conversation or immediate usage of the language. I think it would be better to doing more verbal exercises or free speaking, rather than scripted conversations or written exercises. These exercises were good for on the tests but were not so practical for mastery of the language.
I liked that it was a small class and we got to practice speaking a lot. I suppose we could have received a little bit more grammar instruction.

The strengths of this course were the reinforcements of grammar and idiomatic expressions through assignments and in class speaking. However, I think vocabulary is something that should be taught, rather than just memorizing lists for tests.
Great class

Strengths are many assignments that work on different structures of the language and weakness would be unequal participation. The professor usually chooses who speaks and it usually felt like she'd consistently pick the better students instead of challenging he ones that could use some more work. Also, the professor would only go over things once. Even if it was obvious that the class had no clue what was going on.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No, I would not. I personally had such a bad experience and lost all my desire to learn the German language. If a student is interested in taking German, I would suggest they only take it through L3.
Yes, went above expectations of German 4, but also was more similar to the three lower required levels. I think it was a great section but sometimes felt a little too elementary.
Yes, it's quite a bit of work, but we'll worth it as I feel it improved my German a lot.
Absolutely! Not only did I learn a lot but the professor also fostered a very positive learning environment, so much so that I looked forward to going to class every day.

Yes, I would recommend this because it is a helpful reinforcement of the basis foundations of the language. Also, by being forced to do many assignments and exercises in your language, you will gradually improve in your accuracy and effectiveness in communicating ideas in German.
Definitely! If you want to learn German you need to take this class
I would recommend to anyone who enjoys German language and culture.
